alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Calhoun; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Roane; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 24 at 2:14PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM EST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. Ice jams on area rivers may also produce flooding. * WHERE...Portions of central, northeast, and northern West Virginia, including the following counties, in central West Virginia, Braxton, Calhoun, Gilmer, Roane and Taylor. In northeast West Virginia, Northwest Pocahontas, Northwest Randolph, Northwest Webster, Southeast Pocahontas, Southeast Randolph and Southeast Webster. In northern West Virginia, Barbour, Harrison, Lewis and Upshur. * WHEN...From 7 PM EST this evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rising temperatures and dewpoints combined with incoming rainfall will lead to rapid snowmelt over the northeast West Virginia mountains. Expected snowmelt combined with up to an inch of rainfall late tonight through Friday morning will lead to stream and river rises and local high water concerns. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
